comments:
I have created a cheatsheet which I want to run/open programmatically on an ActionEvent, but I get this error when I try to run my RCP application.

[code]
 Missing required bundle org.eclipse.ui.cheatsheets_0.0.0.
[/code]

OSGi bundle 'org.eclipse.ui.cheatsheets' is setup as one of the dependencies in the MANIFEST.MF. Removing it from the dependencies and commenting out the relevant for invoking the cheatsheet makes the RCP application startup without any errors.

is cheatsheets actually required?  Is it installed?  How did the requirement get there?  

run eclipse with -console and type ss.  See if cheatsheets is there.

(In reply to comment #1)
> is cheatsheets actually required?  Is it installed?  How did the requirement
> get there?  

Yes cheatsheets are required. I have a requirement to provide the user with a User Assistance interface that can walk them thru bits of functionality, hence need for cheatsheet.

> run eclipse with -console and type ss.  See if cheatsheets is there.

The application fails to start up if I simply include (not invoke any cheatsheet code) the 'org.eclipse.ui.cheatsheets' bundle in "Require-Bundle: " section of the MANIFEST.MF, I don't even get to the OSGi prompt where I can issue the 'ss' command. 

The Cheatsheets JAR is in the eclipse installation. Any other idea?

If there's more input required, I am happy to provide.

Below is the full trace of the error that I get:

Run with the following:

eclipse -console -noExit

This should prevent eclipse from exiting on error and allow you to perform the requested ss command:

osgi> ss

All logs indicate you are missing the cheatsheets plugin from you target.

ok, I tried this. The cheatsheets bundle is indeed not showing up. But I do see the cheatsheet bundle dependency in the MANIFEST.MF. 

Looks like something is causing the bundle to be unresolved (not sure why?).

This works for me. Make sure that all the plug-ins required by the cheatsheet plugin are present when you are running the application.
Reopen with detailed steps on how to recreate if you still have a problem.

traces.message: No application id has been found.
